description: Cumans are a cavalry civilization that excels in early game mobility and raiding.
dark_age: Start with 4 villagers and a scout.
Build 2 houses and a barracks near forests.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Use the scout and scouts to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 21-22 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 800-1000 food, 150-200 wood, and 150-200 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 4-5 villagers to food, 2-3 to wood, 1-2 to gold, and 3-4 to stone.
feudal_age: Build additional stables and continue producing cavalry units.
Build a blacksmith and market to upgrade cavalry and sell excess resources for gold.
Advance to Castle Age at around 28-29 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1500-2000 food, 600-800 wood, and 500-600 gold at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 8-10 villagers to food, 5-6 to wood, 3-4 to gold, and 6-7 to stone.
castle_age: Build a siege workshop and start training battering rams.
Research the unique technology, Steppe Husbandry, to produce cavalry from stables without creating villagers.
Build a second town center and start training villagers.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 36-37 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 3500-4000 food, 2000-2500 wood, and 1200-1500 gold at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 10-12 to wood, 8-10 to gold, and 12-15 to stone.
imperial_age: Train kipchaks and research the unique technology, Cuman Mercenaries, to train 10 elite kipchaks at a castle.
Use battering rams and kipchaks to destroy buildings.
Have a constant production of villagers to maintain a strong economy.
Assign villagers accordingly to the current needs of resources.
